content: As an AI language model, I can provide you with a bit more information about the political activism of The Association. The band was involved in various social and political causes of the day, including environmental issues and anti-war efforts. The group was helped by the owner and founder of Ecological Businesses, a natural foods chain in Southern California. The owner sponsored their tours, and the band became known for their support of environmental causes. The Association was also known for performing at various anti-war events, including the Chicano Moratorium in 1970 and a rally for the United Farm Workers' grape boycott in 1973. They even sang on behalf of the Surfrider Foundation in the 1980s, urging the release of bottled water guidelines by the Environmental Protection Agency.
